page.title: 12SHEEP DOG TRIALS,BONAR
page.content: Each summer{sheep dog trials start. There are two kinds, a dog any age or just a dog under three. The under threes is called a Nursery dog trial. The Nursery trials are mainly in the Autumn and there are one or two in the Spring. It is mostly farmers and shepherds who take part. It is all {Collie dogs}that run. They have to have a judge to judge the trials. You get so many points for outruns, penning, etc. First of all you get three sheep which are about 300 yards away. You send your dog away either to the right or to the left. After your dog collects the sheep from the top of the field you have to make your dog drive the sheep down in a straight line through two sets of fetch gates. Then he has to put the sheep in a small pen and shed one.
